description: From French baies, feminine plural of adjective bai (“bay-colored”) mistaken as a singular noun.

entries.meaning: A thick, soft, usually woolen cloth resembling felt; often colored green and used for coverings on card tables, billiard and snooker tables, etc.
(dated) A coarse woolen material with a long nap; usually dyed in plain colors.

verbs.description: baize (third-person singular simple present baizes, present participle baizing, simple past and past participle baized)

entries.meaning: To cover or line with baize.
